analyzeTranslations.help_message:
I18n Translation Analyzer

Usage: node 02-analyze-translations.js [options]

Options:
  --language <lang>      Analyze specific language (default: all)
  --source-dir <dir>     Source directory (default: ./src/locales)
  --output-reports       Generate detailed reports
  --output-dir <dir>     Output directory for reports (default: ./reports)
  --help                 Show this help

Examples:
  node 02-analyze-translations.js --output-reports
  node 02-analyze-translations.js --language=de --output-reports
  node 02-analyze-translations.js --source-dir=./locales --output-dir=./analysis
analyzeTranslations.totalmissing_total_translation: âš ï¸  {{totalMissing}} total translations needed across all languages
analyzeTranslations.2_translate_missing_values_in_: 2. Translate missing values in language files

validateTranslations.help_message:
I18n Translation Validator

Usage: node 03-validate-translations.js [options]

Options:
  --language <lang>      Validate specific language (default: all)
  --source-dir <dir>     Source directory (default: ./src/locales)
  --strict               Enable strict mode (warnings become errors)
  --help                 Show this help

Examples:
  node 03-validate-translations.js
  node 03-validate-translations.js --language=de
  node 03-validate-translations.js --source-dir=./locales --strict
validateTranslations.title: ğŸ” I18N TRANSLATION VALIDATION
validateTranslations.all_validations_passed_transla: ğŸ‰ All validations passed! Translations are complete and consistent.
validateTranslations.consider_running_usage_analysi: ğŸ’¡ Consider running usage analysis to find unused keys
validateTranslations.1_resolve_missing_files_and_sy: 1. Resolve missing files and syntax errors
validateTranslations.2_consider_running_with_strict: 2. Consider running with --strict for stricter validation

sizing.title: I18n Sizing Analyzer
sizing.language_stats_header: Language		Keys		Total Chars		Avg Length		Max Length		Empty Keys
sizing.help_message:
I18n Sizing Analyzer

Usage: node 06-analyze-sizing.js [options]

Options:
  --source-dir <dir>     Source directory containing translation files (default: ./locales)
  --languages <langs>    Comma-separated list of languages to analyze (default: all)
  --output-report        Generate detailed sizing report
  --format <format>      Output format: json, csv, table (default: table)
  --threshold <number>   Size difference threshold for warnings (default: 20%)
  --help                 Show this help message

Examples:
  node 06-analyze-sizing.js --output-report
  node 06-analyze-sizing.js --languages=en,de,fr --format=json
  node 06-analyze-sizing.js --threshold=30 --output-report

checkUsage.help_message:
I18n Usage Analyzer

Usage: node 04-check-usage.js [options]

Options:
  --source-dir <dir>     Source directory to scan (default: ./src)
  --i18n-dir <dir>       I18n directory (default: ./src/locales)
  --output-report        Generate detailed report
  --output-dir <dir>     Output directory for reports (default: ./reports)
  --help                 Show this help

Examples:
  node 04-check-usage.js --output-report
  node 04-check-usage.js --source-dir=./app --i18n-dir=./locales
  node 04-check-usage.js --output-dir=./analysis --output-report

consoleI18nUpdater.help_message:
I18n Console Message Updater

Usage:
  node update-console-i18n.js [options]

Options:
  --dry-run             Show changes without applying them
  --file <filename>     Only update a specific file
  --help                Show this help message

consoleI18nTester.script_description_line1: This script checks if all console messages in the i18n toolkit files
consoleI18nTester.script_description_line2: are using translation keys instead of hardcoded text.
consoleI18nTester.analyzing_console_messages_for: ğŸ” Analyzing console messages for translation key usage
consoleI18nTester.found_hardcoded_console_messag: âš ï¸ Found hardcoded console messages that need translation keys.

consoleI18nTester.suggested_translation_keys_to_: ğŸ“‹ SUGGESTED TRANSLATION KEYS TO ADD
consoleI18nTester.recommendation_1: 1. Replace hardcoded strings with translation keys
consoleI18nTester.recommendation_2: 2. Use this.t('keyName') or i18n.t('keyName') for all user-facing messages
consoleI18nTester.recommendation_3: 3. Add the translation keys to the ui-locales/*.json files
consoleI18nTester.recommendation_4: 4. Re-run this test to verify 100% coverage
consoleI18nTester.add_keys_instruction: Add these keys to your ui-locales/en.json file:
